Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points, dished out 10 assists, and hauled in 4 rebounds.
Boston Celtics took a 75-55 lead by halftime.
Boston Celtics cruised to a 132-119 victory over the New York Knicks.
Jayson Tatum scored 12 points in the third quarter, pushing the Celtics to a 113-87 advantage.
Pre-Game Insights: The Boston Celtics raised their championship banner before the game.
The New York Knicks were expected to be serious challengers for the crown.
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum's offseason training to work on his stroke paid off against the Knicks.
Knicks coach Tom Thibodeau tried various defensive strategies to stop Tatum, but none were effective.
